exercises.sentence: If I ___ (know) about the party, I would have gone.
If she ___ (study) harder, she will pass the exam.
I ___ (call) you if I had your number.
If it ___ (rain), we will stay indoors.
He ___ (not leave) if he had known the truth.
If you ___ (see) her, tell her I said hello.
I wouldn’t have been late if I ___ (wake up) earlier.
If you ___ (exercise) regularly, you would be healthier.
If they ___ (win) the lottery, they would have traveled the world.
If you ___ (not hurry), you will miss the train.
I would buy a new car if I ___ (have) more money.
If we ___ (leave) earlier, we wouldn’t have missed the flight.
If I ___ (be) you, I wouldn’t do that.
If he ___ (speak) English fluently, he would get the job.
If you ___ (not eat) so much, you wouldn’t feel sick.
She will join us if she ___ (finish) her homework on time.
If the weather ___ (not be) so bad, we could go hiking.
I wouldn’t have gone if I ___ (know) it was a bad idea.
If they ___ (help) us, we could finish sooner.
You wouldn’t be tired if you ___ (sleep) more.

topics.title: Passive Voice
topics.description: Practice transforming active sentences into passive.

exercises.sentence: The book ___ (write) by J.K. Rowling.
The cake ___ (eat) before I arrived.
The project ___ (finish) next week.
The house ___ (build) in 1990.
The report ___ (prepare) by the assistant.
The email ___ (send) already.
The window ___ (break) by a stone.
The meeting ___ (schedule) for 10 AM.
The flowers ___ (water) every morning.
The letter ___ (not receive) yet.
The car ___ (repair) by the mechanic.
The room ___ (clean) before guests arrive.
The decision ___ (make) yesterday.
The problem ___ (solve) soon.
The experiment ___ (conduct) by the team.
The invitation ___ (send) tomorrow.
The painting ___ (sell) at auction.
The building ___ (construct) in two years.
The task ___ (complete) before the deadline.
The error ___ (correct) immediately.

topics.title: Reported Speech
topics.description: Practice converting direct speech into reported speech.

exercises.sentence: She said, 'I ___ (be) happy.'
He told me he ___ (not like) it.
She asked if I ___ (want) to join.
He said, 'I ___ (work) tomorrow.'
She said she ___ (finish) her homework.
He asked me where I ___ (live).
She said, 'I ___ (not go) there yesterday.'
He told me he ___ (call) later.
She asked what time I ___ (arrive).
He said, 'I ___ (can) help you.'
She asked if I ___ (be) okay.
He said he ___ (not meet) them before.
She told me she ___ (write) a book.
He said, 'We ___ (go) to the park.'
She said she ___ (be) tired.
He asked me why I ___ (leave).
She said she ___ (have) an idea.
He said, 'I ___ (not see) her recently.'
She asked me if I ___ (know) him.
He said he ___ (not want) to go.

topics.title: Gerunds and Infinitives
topics.description: Practice using gerunds and infinitives in sentences.

exercises.sentence: I enjoy ___ (read) books in my free time.
She decided ___ (apply) for the job.
He admitted ___ (make) a mistake.
They plan ___ (travel) to Europe next summer.
We discussed ___ (move) to a new city.
She avoided ___ (talk) about the problem.
He promised ___ (help) me with my project.
They decided ___ (not take) the risk.
I’m looking forward to ___ (see) you soon.
We need ___ (find) a solution quickly.
She enjoys ___ (paint) landscapes.
He refuses ___ (accept) the offer.
I don’t mind ___ (work) late occasionally.
They suggested ___ (meet) at the café.
She pretended ___ (not see) him.
He kept ___ (ask) the same question.
We can’t afford ___ (buy) a new car.
She mentioned ___ (see) him at the event.
He agreed ___ (join) us for dinner.
I stopped ___ (eat) junk food for my health.

topics.title: Modal Verbs
topics.description: Practice using modal verbs correctly in different contexts.

exercises.sentence: You ___ wear a helmet while cycling.
He ___ play the guitar very well.
She ___ apologize for her mistake.
They ___ arrive late due to traffic.
You ___ touch that, it’s dangerous.
I ___ wim when I was six years old.
We ___ respect our elders.
You ___ leave early if you finish your work.
He ___ be at home; his car is not there.
I ___ called her earlier.
She ___ come to the meeting today.
You ___ finish this before you leave.
We ___ go out now, it’s raining heavily.
He ___ missed the train if he was late.
They ___ need some help with their project.
You ___ speak more politely.
I ___ study hard to pass the exam.
He ___ have forgotten our appointment.
You ___ find this information useful.
We ___ prepare for the worst-case scenario.

topics.title: Relative Clauses
topics.description: Exercise on relative clauses to practice defining and non-defining clauses.

exercises.sentence: The book ___ I borrowed was fantastic.
I met a woman ___ son is a famous actor.
The hotel ___ we stayed in was very comfortable.
This is the restaurant ___ I had my first date.
She’s the person ___ helped me with the project.
The concert, ___ was held in the park, was a huge success.
The painting ___ you see over there is by a famous artist.
He’s the one ___ car was stolen last night.
I don’t like the man ___ lives next door.
The team, ___ was very successful last year, is currently struggling.
The company ___ I work for is expanding rapidly.
Do you remember the day ___ we first met?
She’s the person ___ advice I always follow.
The movie ___ we watched last night was really boring.
It was a place ___ we used to visit every summer.
The report, ___ was submitted yesterday, needs some revisions.
I know the man ___ you were talking to.
She gave me a gift, ___ I thought was very thoughtful.
The store ___ we bought the TV has great customer service.
He is the person ___ I can always rely on.

topics.title: Phrasal Verbs in Context
topics.description: Exercise on phrasal verbs to practice their meanings and uses in sentences.

exercises.sentence: I need to ___ this project by next week.
She ___ the job offer because she wasn’t happy with the salary.
They ___ a new restaurant downtown.
I’ll ___ you after the meeting to discuss the details.
He’s always trying to ___ others to join his project.
We ___ a lot of problems during the construction process.
I can’t believe how quickly time ___ when you’re having fun.
The teacher asked me to ___ the assignment by Friday.
She ___ with a solution that impressed everyone in the meeting.
They ___ the news about the merger last month.
I didn’t expect her to ___ my invitation to the party.
They will ___ the new software next month.
She always ___ when things get tough.
The company is trying to ___ their services to more countries.
He ___ with his old friend at the reunion.
We need to ___ the contract before starting the project.
I couldn’t ___ the noise outside while trying to sleep.
They ___ all their efforts to finish the project on time.
Can you ___ me on the status of the project?
I ___ the task, but I’ll finish it tomorrow.

topics.title: Inversion
topics.description: Exercise on inversion to practice using inverted sentence structures for emphasis or formality.

exercises.sentence: Rarely ___ I seen such a breathtaking view.
Not only ___ she talented, but she is also very hardworking.
Under no circumstances ___ you leave the premises without permission.
Little ___ they know about the surprise awaiting them.
Seldom ___ we encounter such a complex problem.
Hardly ___ I entered the room when the phone rang.
Only after the meeting ___ we realize the importance of the issue.
Never before ___ the team faced such a difficult challenge.
Scarcely ___ the bell stopped ringing when the students rushed out.
Not until the end of the movie ___ I understand its meaning.
So rarely ___ she complain about anything that it surprised us all.
On no account ___ this door be left unlocked.
No sooner ___ he started speaking than the audience began to clap.
Only by working together ___ we achieve our goals.
Nowhere else ___ you find such a variety of goods.
Hardly ever ___ they visit us anymore.
No sooner ___ I finished my homework than the power went out.
Only rarely ___ he show his emotions.
Not until the lights went out ___ we realize how dark it was.
In no way ___ the problem be ignored any longer.

topics.title: Collocations with 'Make' and 'Do'
topics.description: Exercise on common collocations with 'make' and 'do' to practice choosing the correct verb.

exercises.sentence: Can you ___ me a favor and help with this task?
We need to ___ a decision by the end of the day.
She always ___ her homework on time.
Let’s ___ an effort to arrive on time tomorrow.
He promised to ___ his best in the competition.
You should ___ a list of all the things you need to buy.
She ___ a mistake while calculating the expenses.
It’s important to ___ a good impression during your interview.
Could you ___ the cleaning while I cook dinner?
He decided to ________ some research before starting the project.
She wants to ________ a complaint about the poor service.
I forgot to ___ the dishes after dinner last night.
He needs to ___ a phone call before leaving.
They ___ a lot of money from selling handmade crafts.
We should ___ plans for the weekend soon.
I didn’t have time to ___ my bed this morning.
She always ___ a point of helping others.
He had to ___ an excuse for being late again.
You should ___ your hair before we leave.
We’re trying to ___ arrangements for the conference.

topics.title: Phrasal Verbs
topics.description: Practice forming sentences with commonly used phrasal verbs in English. Complete the sentences by filling in the blanks with the correct phrasal verb.

exercises.sentence: He didn't understand the instructions, so he had to look them ___ again.
Can you turn ___ the volume? It's too loud in here.
We set ___ early in the morning to avoid traffic.
She came ___ a rare coin while cleaning the attic.
The meeting was called ___ due to the storm.
He ran ___ of money halfway through his trip.
I can't put ___ with this noise anymore!
Please fill ___ the form and submit it at the desk.
They brought ___ a new policy to improve work conditions.
The fire fighters managed to put ___ the fire in just an hour.
She took ___ yoga to reduce stress.
I need to catch ___ on the work I missed during my vacation.
He gave ___ smoking after 10 years.
The teacher pointed ___ several mistakes in his essay.
They broke ___ after five years of dating.
I can't figure ___ how to solve this problem.
We should get ___ the train at the next station.
She hung ___ the phone without saying goodbye.
I'll look ___ your proposal and get back to you.
He turned ___ a job offer because it didn't meet his expectations.
